prompt: Which of the following is copyrighted by its creator?
feedback: An original article on a blog is copyrighted by the writer, whether or not it has a copyright notice. The other choices either aren’t original content, or they’re old enough that their copyright would be expired. A simple calendar wouldn’t be copyrighted, because the progression of days and months is common knowledge. A digital version of the Declaration of Independence is a copy of a public domain work, so there is no copyright. The same is true of a photograph of a painting from 1649. The painting is old enough that the copyright would be expired.
